greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers whose dual Zeckendorf representations (A104326) are palindromic.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 4 is a term since its dual Zeckendorf representation, 101, is palindromic.
mathematica: select[v_, mid_] := Select[v, Length[#] == 0 || Last[#] != mid &];
Union@Join[{0}, fib /@ Join[mirror[#, {}] & /@ (select[pals, 0]), mirror[#, {0}] & /@ (select[pals, 0]), mirror[#, {1}] & /@ pals]]
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 11 2020
